div.head: To his vvorthy Cosen, THOMAS HERBERT Esquire.
div.l: WHen first thou traueldst I disswaded, then
Fearing thy youth, hot Climates, faithlesse men.
This second journey on the Schollers Stage
I feare: not for the weaknesse of thy age▪
But for the frozen Zone thou didst not 〈◊〉
Whence mystie wits may rise to darken thee.
But since thy first aduenture prou'd so well,
Proceed, The Truth is great and shall preuaile.
